context.p: When the default layout and output of the DocBook to PDF transformation needs to be customized, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Create a custom version of the DocBook title spec file.

info.p: You should start from a copy of the file /frameworks/docbook/xsl/fo/titlepage.templates.xml and customize it. The instructions for the spec file can be found here.

step.cmd: Generate a new XSLT stylesheet from the title spec file from the previous step.
step.info: Apply /frameworks/docbook/xsl/template/titlepage.xsl to the title spec file. The result is an XSLT stylesheet (for example, mytitlepages.xsl).

step.cmd: Import mytitlepages.xsl in a DocBook customization layer.
step.info: The customization layer is the stylesheet that will be applied to the XML document. The mytitlepages.xsl should be imported with an element like this:<xsl:import href="dir-name/mytitlepages.xsl"/>

step.cmd: Insert a logo image in the XML document.
step.info: The path to the logo image must be inserted in the book/info/mediaobject element of the XML document.

step.cmd: Apply the customization layer to the XML document.
step.info: A quick way is to duplicate the transformation scenario DocBook PDF that is included with and set the customization layer in the XSL URL property of the scenario.

link.linktext: The book DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide by Bob Stayton contains more details about customizing the PDF output.
